channel.title: Tools on Climate Tools
channel.description: Recent content in Tools on Climate Tools

item.title: DGIF Wildlife Action Plan
item.description: Developed By: VDGIF Summary: Virginia’s 2015 Wildlife Action Plan contains ecological data and conservation plans for hundreds of species.

item.title: Coastal County Snapshots
item.description: Developed By: NOAA_Office for Coastal Management Summary: Providing detailed reports across the country this tool is useful for anyone seeking to understand their county’s flood risk, ocean-related job opportunities, and/or wetland benefits.

item.title: PINEMAP
item.description: Developed By: North Carolina State Climate Office, and USDA Summary: PINEMAP is a suite of 13 products focusing on loblolly pines in the Southeastern US across four categories: Environment, Establishment, Management, and Production.

item.title: OpenNSPECT
item.description: Developed By: NOAA_Office for Coastal Management Summary: This open-source version of the Nonpoint Source Pollution and Erosion Comparison Tool is used to investigate potential water quality impacts from climate change and development to other land uses.

item.title: Earth::Global wind patterns
item.description: Developed By: Cameron Beccario Summary: This real-time visualization of global environmental conditions is a great illustration of atmospheric and oceanic circulation and Earth’s physical systems.

item.title: OSPREY Public
item.description: Developed By: NOAA_NWS Summary: Operation and Situational Preparedness for Responding to an Emergency (OSPREY) is an interactive map for Maryland that presents users with statewide current conditions on weather, traffic, and electrical outages.

item.title: Delaware Air Quality Forecast
item.description: Developed By: DDNREC Summary: The Delaware Air Quality Forecast is a user-friendly forecast that provides daily air quality forecasts for the state of Delaware.

item.title: Storm Water Management Model (SWMM)
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: The EPA’s Storm Water Management Model (SWMM) is a software application that simulates water runoff quantity and quality.

item.title: Diagnostic Spreadsheet for Analysis of Water Quality Data in relation to Growth Requirements of Submerged Aquatic Vegetation
item.description: Developed By: CBP Summary: The Diagnostic Spreadsheet for Analysis of Water Quality Data analyzes Total Suspended Solids (TSS) and Chlorophyll data to determine if minimum light requirements for submerged aquatic vegetation (SAV) growth are met at a given station.

item.title: Green Infrastructure Modeling Toolkit
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Not Available Get This Tool Geographic Coverage Not Available

item.title: USGS Water Data for the Nation
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS Water Data for the Nation is a data portal that allows users to view real time data from approximately 1.

item.title: Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) Land Cover Atlas
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, USDOC, and NOAA_National Ocean Service Summary: The Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) Land Cover Atlas is an interactive mapping tool that allows user to view changes in coastal land cover from 1996-2010 throughout the US.

item.title: Flood Economics
item.description: Developed By: The Economist Intelligence Unit, and FEMA Summary: Based on analyses by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU), the Flood Economics Tool provides information, data, and case studies describing the benefits of flood mitigation investments at the state and community level.

item.title: Nature's Network Prioritization Tool
item.description: Developed By: Nature’s Network Summary: The Prioritization Tool from Nature’s Network is an interactive mapping tool that helps identify conservation priorities, such as rare and threatened habitats for species of greatest conservation need.

item.title: Future Urban Climates
item.description: Developed By: UMCES Summary: The Future Urban Climates tool is an interactive map showing how climate may change within the next 60 years in 540 cities across the US.

item.title: Coastal Change Hazards Portal
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS Coastal Change Hazards Portal is an easy to use tool that synthesizes geospatial information about extreme storms, shorelines change, and sea level rise and makes it available for viewing and download.

item.title: Bay Footprint Calculator
item.description: Developed By: CBF, and UVA Summary: The Bay Footprint Calculator is an easy-to-use tool that estimates your contribution to nitrogen pollution in the Chesapeake Bay.

item.title: National Beach Nourishment Database
item.description: Developed By: American Shore & Beach Protection Agency, Regional Sediment Management Program, and APTIM

item.title: Adaptation Workbook (Climate Change Response Framework)
item.description: Developed By: Northern Institute for Applied Climate Science, and USDA_USFS

item.title: Beach Nourishment Viewer
item.description: Developed By: Western Carolina University_Program for the Study of Developed Shorelines

item.title: Delaware Environmental Monitoring Sites
item.description: Developed By: DEMAC, Delaware Geological Survey, and University of Delaware

item.title: Surging Seas Risk Zone Map (SSRZM)
item.description: Developed By: Climate Central Summary: The Surging Seas Risk Zone Map (SSRZM) displays coastal areas predicted to experience the effects of sea level rise (SLR) within the U.

item.title: i-Tree Hydro, and Eco
item.description: Developed By: USFS, Davey Tree Expert Company, Arbor Day Foundation, Society of Municipal Arborists, International Society of Arboriculture, Casey Trees, and SUNY_College of Environmental Science and Forestry.

item.title: i-Tree Canopy
item.description: Developed By: USFS, Davey Tree Expert Company, Arbor Day Foundation, Society of Municipal Arborists, International Society of Arboriculture, Casey Trees, and SUNY_College of Environmental Science and Forestry.

item.title: i-Tree Design
item.description: Developed By: USFS, Davey Tree Expert Company, Arbor Day Foundation, Society of Municipal Arborists, International Society of Arboriculture, Casey Trees, and SUNY_College of Environmental Science and Forestry.

item.title: i-Tree Mytree and Landscape
item.description: Developed By: USFS, Davey Tree Expert Company, Arbor Day Foundation, Society of Municipal Arborists, International Society of Arboriculture, Casey Trees, and SUNY_College of Environmental Science and Forestry.

item.title: i-Tree
item.description: Developed By: USFS, Davey Tree Expert Company, Arbor Day Foundation, Society of Municipal Arborists, International Society of Arboriculture, Casey Trees, and SUNY_College of Environmental Science and Forestry.

item.title: Mapping Social Vulnerability of Fishing Communities
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: NOAA Fisheries Social Indicators Toolbox is comprised of a suite of social, economic, and environmental indicators that describe and evaluate a community’s ability to respond to change.

item.title: USGS National Water Census Data Portal: Streamflow
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS National Water Census Data Portal Streamflow tool allows users to address streamflow averages for a specific locality, if a nearby stream gage is available.

item.title: USGS National Water Census Data Portal: Water Budget
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS National Water Census Data Portal Water Budget tool allows users to download water budget data for a selected watershed, based on the nearest water gage.

item.title: USGS National Water Census Data Portal
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: Data portal that provides data on Water Budget and Stream Flow

item.title: FEMA Data Visualizations of Disaster Declarations and Grants
item.description: Developed By: FEMA Summary: FEMA’s Data Visualization tools allow users to explore when and where disaster declarations have occurred across the US through interactive graphs and figures.

item.title: Potomac Inundation Maps
item.description: Developed By: DC Silver Jackets, NOAA_NWS, USACE, USGS, City of Alexandria, and DCDOEE

item.title: Riparian Restoration Decision Support Tool
item.description: Developed By: Appalachian Landscape Conservation Cooperative, USFS, and University of Massachusetts

item.title: FEMA's National Flood Hazard Layer (NFHL) Viewer
item.description: Developed By: FEMA Summary: The National Flood Hazard Layer (NFHL) is an interactive mapping tool that allows users to view flood hazard maps and download Flood Insurance Rate Maps (FIRMS) from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA).

item.title: Water Quality Assessment and TMDLs
item.description: Developed By: MDE Summary: This interactive mapping tool displays surface water quality assessment information found in Maryland’s 2018 Integrated Report of Surface Water Quality (IR) as well as watersheds for which Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) analyses have been approved by EPA for Maryland.

item.title: MDOT Climate Change Vulnerability
item.description: Developed By: MDOT_State Highway Administration, Salisbury University, and the Eastern Shore Regional GIS Cooperative

item.title: Chesapeake Bay Interpretive Buoy System (CBIBS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: The Chesapeake Bay Interpretive Buoys System (CBIBS) is a network of ocean observing platforms that provide real-time access to meteorological, oceanographic and water quality data throughout the Chesapeake Bay.

item.title: Chesapeake Assessment Scenario Tool (CAST)
item.description: Developed By: CBP Summary: The Chesapeake Assessment Scenario Tool (CAST) is a web-based nitrogen, phosphorus and sediment load modeling tool designed to streamline environmental planning.

item.title: Air Quality Forecast
item.description: Developed By: Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments Summary: The Air Quality Forecast is a 3-part forecast, chart, and mapping tool that provides daily air quality forecasts for the Washington metropolitan area.

item.title: DC Department of Energy & Environment: DC Solar Tool
item.description: Developed By: Mapdwell, and Massachusetts Institute of Technology Summary: The D.

item.title: DC Department of Energy & Environment: Green Infrastructure Practices in the District
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: This interactive mapping tool displays locations within Washington D.

item.title: DC Department of Energy & Environment: DC Flood Risk Map
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: The DC Flood Risk Tool uses an interactive map to display the risk of various types of flooding throughout the District.

item.title: DC Department of Energy and Environment: SRC Trading Program Impervious Viewer
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: The SRC Trading Impervious Viewer is an interactive mapping tool that displays large impervious surfaces such as parking lots, driveways, and buildings in the District of Columbia.

item.title: DC Department of Energy and Environment: Targeted Subwatersheds
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: Targeted Subwatersheds is a simple mapping tool that displays watershed boundaries, TMDL subwatersheds targeted for Waste Load Allocation (WLA) prioritization, as well as the D.

item.title: DC Department of Energy and Environment Data & Maps
item.description: Developed By: DCDOEE Summary: Tool that includes SRC Trading Program Impervious Viewer, Targeted Subwatersheds, Solar System, DC Green Infrastructure Practices in the District, and DC Flood Risk

item.title: United States Drought Monitor
item.description: Developed By: NDMC, University of Nebraska-Lincoln, USDA, and NOAA Summary: The United States Drought Monitor (USDM) is an interactive tool that allows users to view drought conditions at a regional scale within the United States and territories.

item.title: Northeast Conservation Planning Atlas
item.description: Developed By: Conservation Biology Institute Summary: The Northeast Conservation Planning Atlas (CPA) is an online mapping platform where users can view, retrieve, and analyze spatial data for conservation planning in the Northeast US.

item.title: Climate Change in the American Mind (CCAM) Explorer
item.description: Developed By: Yale_Yale Program on Climate Change Communication, and George Mason University_Center for Climate Change Communication

item.title: Virginia Coastal Geospatial and Educational Mapping System (GEMS)
item.description: Developed By: VDEQ Summary: The Virginia Coastal Geospatial and Educational Mapping System (Coastal GEMS) is an interactive map and inventory of coastal resource data and conservation planning tools for Virginia’s coastal zone.

item.title: Mid-Atlantic Ocean Data Tool
item.description: Developed By: MARCO Summary: The Mid-Atlantic Ocean Data Portal is a resource center consisting of an interactive map, data layers, case studies, and collaborative tools that allows users to explore and share visualizations of coastal and societal resources from New York to Virginia.

item.title: Grape Hardiness & Freeze Risk
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Grape Freeze Risk Tool predicts the potential freeze damage for 3 varieties of grapes.

item.title: CSF Apple Stage / Freeze Damage Probability
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Apple Stage/Freeze Probability Tool predicts the potential freeze damage for 3 varieties of apple crops.

item.title: Climate Smart Farming (CSF) Winter Cover Crop Planting Scheduler
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Winter Cover Crop Planting Scheduler calculates the probability that specific cover crops reach important levels of growth by the end of the growing season.

item.title: Climate Smart Farming (CSF) Water Deficit Calculator
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Water Deficit Calculator estimates soil water content within a crop’s effective root zone to predict potential water deficits and associated plant stress.

item.title: Climate Smart Farming (CSF) Growing Degree Day Calculator
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Growing Degree Day Calculator calculates and plots observed and predicted growing degree days for a given location during a growing season.

item.title: Climate Smart Farming Climate Change in Your County
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: Part of the Climate Smart Farming toolkit, the Climate Change in Your County tool allows users to view historic and projected future temperature and precipitation data within their county and region.

item.title: Climate Smart Farming
item.description: Developed By: Cornell University_College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Summary: The Climate Smart Farming tool is a toolkit intended to help farmers from the Northeast US improve their productivity and resiliency within the context of a changing climate.

item.title: Submerged Aquatic Vegetation (SAV) in the Chesapeake Bay
item.description: Developed By: VIMS Summary: The Submerged Aquatic Vegetation (SAV) in Chesapeake Bay tool provides access to recent and historical SAV monitoring data from the Virginia Institute of Marine Science SAV program.

item.title: Virginia Estuarine and Coastal Observing System (VECOS)
item.description: Developed By: VIMS Summary: The Virginia Estuarine and Coastal Observing System (VECOS) provides access to water quality and meteorological data from a variety of monitoring programs conducted by the Chesapeake Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve (CBNERR) in Virginia.

item.title: USDA Plant Hardiness Zone Map
item.description: Developed By: USDA Summary: The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) Plant hardiness Zone Map provides static and interactive maps to determine which plants are most likely to thrive at a location throughout the United States.

item.title: Annual United States Climate Stripes: Temperature and Precipitation
item.description: Developed By: NCICS Summary: The Annual United State Climate Stripes is a climate visualization tool designed to depict changes in temperature and precipitation through the United States.

item.title: Delaware Climate Projections Portal
item.description: Developed By: DDNREC_Division of Energy & Climate Summary: The Delaware Climate Change Projections Portal allows users to easily find and download downscaled climate projection data for the state of Delaware.

item.title: Percent Light at Leaf Calculator
item.description: Developed By: CBP Summary: The Percent Light at Leaf (PLL) calculator can be used to estimate the percentage of light penetrating the water column and reaching submerged aquatic vegetation (SAV) leaf surface at a given depth.

item.title: Chesapeake Bay Program DataHub
item.description: Developed By: CBP Summary: The DataHub is the Chesapeake Bay Program’s primary tool for searching and downloading environmental data for the Chesapeake Bay watershed.

item.title: Eyes On The Bay: Main site
item.description: Developed By: MDNR Summary: Eyes On The Bay provides maps, data and information about tidal water quality conditions and impacts in the state of Maryland.

item.title: Drought Management Database
item.description: Developed By: NDMC Summary: The Drought Management Database is a growing collection of strategies to manage and prepare for drought impacts in the United States.

item.title: Drought Risk Atlas
item.description: Developed By: NDMC, NOAA_NWS, and NOAA_RCC Summary: The Drought Risk Atlas provides historical drought information for weather stations across the United States through an interactive map viewer and data portal.

item.title: Drought-Applied Climate Information System (ACIS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA_RCC Summary: The Applied Climate Information System (ACIS) Drought Portal allows users to view past and current temperature and precipitation data from weather stations throughout the US.

item.title: Climate Engine
item.description: Developed By: Desert Research Institute, University of Idaho, and Google

item.title: Climate Impact Map
item.description: Developed By: Climate Impact Lab Summary: The Climate Impact Map is an interactive mapping tool that displays historical and projected changes in future temperature in the United States and across the globe.

item.title: My Environment
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: The EPA’s MyEnvironment tool is an online dashboard that provides access to a cross-section environmental information specific to a user’s location.

item.title: FloodiQ
item.description: Developed By: First Street Foundation Summary: FloodiQ is a flood risk mapping tool that shows the extent of potential inundation from tidal flooding and hurricane storm surge on the East and Gulf coasts of the U.

item.title: FieldWatch
item.description: Developed By: Fieldwatch, and Purdue Research Foundation Summary: FieldWatch is a community mapping tool that allows beekeepers, crop growers, and pesticide applicators to interact through four connected tools: BeeCheck, Fieldcheck, Cropcheck, and Drift Watch.

item.title: Headwaters Economics Neighborhoods at Risk
item.description: Developed By: Headwater Economics Summary: The Headwaters Economics Neighborhoods at Risk tool uses an interactive map to display characteristics of potentially vulnerable neighborhoods in 27 U.

item.title: Coastal Inundation Predictions for Maryland
item.description: Developed By: UMCES Summary: The Coastal Inundation Predictions is a report on Sea Level Rise on coastal Maryland.

item.title: Wetbud: Wetland Water Budget Modeling Software
item.description: Developed By: Wetland Studies and Solutions, Inc. Summary: The Wetbud: Wetland Water Budget Modeling Software is a software application that calculates a water budget for a created or existing wetland.

item.title: MARISA Climate Impacts Summary and Outlook Reports
item.description: Developed By: MARISA Summary: The MARISA Climate Impacts Summary and Outlook Reports are a quarterly series summarizing seasonal weather and climate trends and forecasts for the Chesapeake Bay Watershed.

item.title: Shoreline Assessment Mapper
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The Shoreline Assessment Mapper is an interactive map that displays a variety of shoreline data for the coastal zone of Virginia.

item.title: Shoreline Management Self-Guided Decision Tools
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The CCRM Shoreline Management Self-Guided Decision Tools guide users through a series of questions about shoreline conditions to provide a shoreline best management practice recommendation.

item.title: Virginia Flood Risk Information System (VFRIS)
item.description: Developed By: VIMS, CCRM, and VDCR Summary: The Virginia Flood Risk Information System uses an interactive map to display FEMA flood risk zones in Virginia.

item.title: Sea Level Report Cards
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The Sea-Level Report cards provide interactive graphs and narrative descriptions of sea-level trends and projections for 32 coastal locations across the U.

item.title: Better Assessment Science Integrating Point and Non-point Sources (BASIN)
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Better Assessment Science Integrating Point and Nonpoint Sources (BASINS) is a multipurpose environmental analysis system designed to help regional, state, and local agencies perform watershed- and water quality-based studies.

item.title: NOAA State Climate Summaries
item.description: Developed By: NOAA_NCEI, and NCICS Summary: The State Climate Summaries consist of brief statewide reports, describing historical climate conditions and future climate scenarios.

item.title: MARISA Climate Data Portal: Interactive Map for the MARISA Region
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and MARISA Summary: The Interactive Map for the MARISA region is an interactive web map that enables users to view real time climate data for the MARISA region.

item.title: MARISA Climate Data Portal: Climate Data for the Mid-Atlantic Region
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and MARISA Summary: The MARISA Climate Data Portal is a data download center that provides climate data from a variety of sources for the Chesapeake Bay region.

item.title: Introduction to FEMA Coastal Floodplain Mapping
item.description: Developed By: FEMA Summary: This educational tool describes how coastal risks are shown on Flood Insurance Rate Maps (FIRMs, or flood maps) and teaches users how to interpret coastal flood maps.

item.title: Know Your Zone
item.description: Developed By: VDEM Summary: The Know Your Zone tool is an interactive mapping tool that allows residents of coastal Virginia to determine their evacuation zone for hurricanes and severe storms.

item.title: Eastern Virginia Coastal Resilience (ESVA Coastal Resilience)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and TNC Summary: The Virginia Eastern Shore Coastal Resilience tool is an interactive mapping tool that allows users to visualize potential social, economic, and environmental impacts of sea level rise and storm surge and identify areas for nature-based solutions to enhance resilience and reduce risks where possible.

item.title: USGS Exploration and Graphics for RivEr Trends (EGRET)
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The Exploration and Graphics RivEr Trends (EGRET) is an R package for the analysis of hydrologic data concerning long-term changes in rivers, river flows, and river quality.

item.title: Storm Surge Inundation Map
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Part of the Climate Ready Water Utilities Tool (CRWU), the Storm Surge Inundation tool is a map interface depicting extreme weather conditions.

item.title: Climate Ready Water Utilities Adaptation Strategies Guide for Water Utilities
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Part of the Creating Resilient Water Utilities Tool (CRWU), the Adaptation Strategies Guide is a beginner resource for water utilities working on a preliminary identification of adaptation strategies specific to their needs.

item.title: Case Study and Information Exchange
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Part of the Creating Resilient Water Utilities Tool (CRWU), the Case Study and Information Exchange provides examples from water utilities that have implemented adaptation measures for natural hazards and water management challenges such as climate change.

item.title: CREAT Risk Assessment Application for Water Utilities
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Part of the Creating Resilient Water Utilities (CRWU) initiative, the Climate Resilience Evaluation and Awareness Tool (CREAT) 3.

item.title: Creating Resilient Water Utilities (CRWU)
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: The CRWU provides tools, training, and technical assistance for drinking water, wastewater, and stormwater utilities to build climate resilience.

item.title: USGS Geo Data Portal (GDP)
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS Geo Data Portal (GDP) is designed for advanced users looking to access meteorological, climate, and urban growth data at national and regional scales.

item.title: Maryland Coastal Atlas
item.description: Developed By: MDNR Summary: The Maryland Coastal Atlas is a mapping tool that allows users query, map, and analyze spatial data to better understand Maryland’s coastal and marine resources.

item.title: Resilience Adaptation Feasibility Tool (The RAFT)
item.description: Developed By: UVA_IEN, WM_VCPC, ODU, and VSG Summary: The RAFT is a collaborative, year-long process designed to assist coastal localities working to improve their climate resilience.

item.title: Virginia Wetland Condition Assessment Tool (WetCAT)
item.description: Developed By: CCRM, and VDEQ Summary: The Virginia Wetland Condition Assessment Tool (WetCAT) is an interactive map that assesses wetland capacity to perform ecosystem services and provides the tools to conduct analyses useful for wetland restoration efforts.

item.title: Delaware Bay Operational Forecast System (DBOFS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and Rutgers University_Regional Ocean Modeling System Summary: The Delaware Bay Operational Forecast System (DBOFS) tool is a data viewer that provides real time forecasts of oceanographic conditions in the Delaware Bay.

item.title: Chesapeake Bay Operational Forecast System (CBOFS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: The Chesapeake Bay Operational Forecast System (CBOFS) tool is a data viewer that provides real time forecasts of oceanographic conditions in the Chesapeake Bay.

item.title: Operational Forecast System
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: Tool including the Chesapeake Bay Forecast System and Delaware Bay Forecast System

item.title: Hampton Roads Resilience Projects Dashboard
item.description: Developed By: HRPDC, HRSD, and HRTPO Summary: Part of the Hampton Roads Geospatial Exchange Online portal, this tool provides summary graphics and an interactive map to view current and proposed projects to improve resilience to flooding and coastal hazards in Hampton Roads, VA.

item.title: Hampton Roads Sea Level Rise Planning Scenarios
item.description: Developed By: HRPDC, HRSD, and HRTPO Summary: Part of Hampton Roads Geographic Exchange Online, the Hampton Roads Sea Level Rise Planning Scenarios uses an interactive map to display sea level rise projections for Hampton Roads.

item.title: Hampton Roads Geospatial Exchange Online (HRGEO)
item.description: Developed By: HRPDC, HRSD, and HRTPO Summary: HRGEO is a data portal that allows to users to view and download geographic, cultural, and population data in Hampton Roads, VA.

item.title: AdaptVA Interactive Map
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: This tool from AdaptVA uses an interactive map to display sea level rise projections and FEMA flood hazard zones, as well as social vulnerability, infrastructure, and natural capital in a single viewer.

item.title: AdaptVA Tidewatch Map
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The AdaptVA Tidewatch Map uses an interactive map to display coastal flooding in Virginia.

item.title: AdaptVA Sea Level Rise Projection Viewer
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The AdaptVA Sea Level Rise Projection Viewer uses an interactive map to display sea level rise projections for coastal Virginia.

item.title: AdaptVA
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: Tool that includes Sea Level Rise Projection Viewers, Tidewatch Map, and Interactive Map
